meta.title: Alexandre De Cuyper | Physics Researcher
meta.description: Alexandre De Cuyper - Physics Researcher specializing in soft matter, polymer physics, and scattering techniques
meta.ogDescription: Experimental physicist specializing in soft matter, polymer dynamics, and scattering techniques (SAXS/SANS). Master's in Physics of Soft Matter from Université Paris Cité.

hero.name: Alexandre De Cuyper
hero.title: Experimental Physicist
hero.tagline: Specializing in soft matter physics, polymer dynamics, and scattering techniques with computational modeling

about.title: About Me
about.lead: Experimental physicist with an international dual Master's degree in Physics of Soft Matter from Université Paris Cité and Complex Materials from Universidad de La Coruña, obtained through a collaborative Erasmus+ program.
about.paragraph1: My research focuses on soft matter physics with a specialization in polymer dynamics and scattering techniques (SAXS/SANS, DLS). I combine rigorous experimental methods with computational modeling using Python and C/C++ to investigate complex phenomena at the nanoscale.
about.paragraph2: Currently preparing for doctoral school entrance exams, I'm passionate about understanding the fundamental behavior of soft materials through both experiment and theory. Beyond physics, I maintain a broad intellectual curiosity spanning philosophy, history, and analytical thinking across disciplines.

research.title: Research & Publications
research.subtitle: Experimental work, academic outputs, and professional development

thesis.title: Polymer Wetting Dynamics on Nano-textured Surfaces
thesis.description: Investigated polymer wetting behavior on nano-structured surfaces using optical microscopy, advanced scattering techniques (SAXS/SANS) and atomic force microscopy. Developed Python pipeline to analyze hundreds of image sequences.

training.title: Formation Annuelle à la Neutronique
training.description: Completed intensive 3-day practical training organized by 2FDN in collaboration with ILL. Followed the soft matter & biophysics track with courses on SANS and time-of-flight/backscattering spectroscopy, followed by hands-on practicals and data analysis at Europe's leading neutron facility.

spring2024.title: Spring 2024 Technical Research Projects
spring2024.description: Five experimental physics projects conducted during Erasmus+ exchange, covering materials characterization, thermal analysis, laser spectroscopy, pressure-modulated calorimetry, and advanced statistical analysis techniques.

libs.title: Laser Spectroscopy (LIBS)
libs.desc: Spectral analysis of cosmetic samples and gel impurity detection using Laser Induced Breakdown Spectroscopy

visco.title: Viscoelasticity Analysis
visco.desc: A comprehensive analysis of 3D-printed PLA samples using Dynamic Mechanical Analysis (DMA) and Time-Temperature Superposition (TTS) for master curve construction.

xrd.title: X-ray Diffraction
xrd.desc: Statistical powder XRD analysis with ANOVA and peak fitting

perovskite.title: Perovskite Thermal
perovskite.desc: Differential Calorimetry Analysis of perovskite materials and heat capacity measurement using ASTM three-run method

mpdsc.title: Modulated Pressure DSC
mpdsc.desc: A novel experimental approach for thermo-mechanical analysis of materials using pressure modulation in DSC experiments.

archive.title: Optical Nano-antennas
archive.venue: Institut de nanoscience de Paris, Sorbonne Université
archive.description: Studied light-matter interactions at the nanoscale during L3 internship. Applied electromagnetic scattering theory and developed computational simulations to model optical nano-antenna behavior.

portal.title: Computational Projects
portal.description: Explore open-source computational physics projects, data analysis tools, and scientific software development work from GitHub and GitLab.

contact.title: Get in Touch
contact.text: I'm currently preparing for doctoral school entrance exams and exploring research opportunities in soft matter physics, polymer dynamics, and scattering techniques. Feel free to reach out for collaborations, discussions, or opportunities.
